title: "Magnetic Treatment Techniques: Positive and Negative Effects"
first_phrase: In the previous part of this text, the author discussed two types of magnetic treatment: touch and non-touch. The touch method is effective for weakness and paralysis, while the non-touch method is more calming and strengthens positive illnesses. In the last part, the author introduces a mixed form of treatment where hands are placed on the affected areas to warm and dissolve, or to strengthen the major organs. The treatment aims to restore the body's natural functions and is recommended for negative health conditions.

last_phrase: In conclusion, magnetic therapy has been known to have positive effects on some people. We advise you to try the techniques described in this text carefully and gradually, starting with the more general strokes, and move on to more precise techniques. Keep in mind that negative influences, like quick strokes or blowing on inflamed areas, should be avoided.
